solution_line_template: If half of the people in Nantucket are going to the planned meeting, then there are {meeting_fraction}*{total_people_nantucket} = <<{total_people_nantucket}*{meeting_fraction}={people_attending_meeting}>>{people_attending_meeting} people going to the meeting.

After dividing both sides by {male_female_ratio_sum}, we have x = {people_attending_meeting}/{male_female_ratio_sum} = <<{people_attending_meeting}/{male_female_ratio_sum}={females_count}>>{females_count}
The number of females attending the meeting is x = <<{females_count}={females_count}>>{females_count}
